wireless hackers delight.. heh
i remember going through many 'cheap' cards at the store until i found some with atheros chipsets.
always wished i could have had an orinoco gold

I had the HawkingTechnology HWU8110UG I think it was.. 3-4inch satellite dish, usb.. had an Atheros AR5007 if I recall correctly.. it was great.. that company makes some decent cheap stuff, worth checking out their website
only cost me about $60 and best buy several years ago and worked great on linux.. just required the zydas firmware zd1211 package
thanks for the info. i might just have to look around
the range on that thing was insane.. I could hit all 3 APs at the WVU colleseum from almost 2mi away across the river
only downside to those kinda things is that you generally need to be within 30deg or so of right angle and have a clear line of sight for max distance
christ thats impressive for a pre-built card
had +8dbi gain and was extremely portable and convenient
a buddy and i used to build cantennas that had suprisingly good results. but also had a very narrow angle of range
was that a usb card? or pcmcia?

it was a USB dish.. was about 3inches diameter and rotated 180deg and tilted up and down about 45deg was really nice for US$60 price range site is hawkingtechnology.com they have newer better ones out now..
question is if they support blackfriday right now. wouldn't that be nice.
ha, now if only i could call it an early christmas present to the girlfriend i could justify it.
you think they still put atheros in them?

well the one that replaced the HWU8DD I had, is the HWU9DD and it is said to have a RTL8188SU, the do have another model though and you can still find the HWU8DD which is technically a Zydas ZD1211RW chipset, but its essentially just a modified Atheros 5007UG and the firmware is available in the zd1211rw-firmware package for linux
